citing_paper_authors: Yuping, Zhou | Nianwen, Xue
raw_text: In the realm of discourse annotation, the Penn Discourse TreeBank (PDTB) (Prasad et al, 2008) separates itself by adopting a lexically grounded approach: Discourse relations are lexically anchored by discourse connectives (e.g., because, but, therefore), which are viewed as predicates that take abstract objects such as propositions, events and states as their arguments
clean_text: In the realm of discourse annotation, the Penn Discourse TreeBank (PDTB) (Prasad et al, 2008) separates itself by adopting a lexically grounded approach.
